docs.lead_paragraph: Just how many people were fascinated/flustered/baffled by Lady Gaga's gender-bending turn on the MTV Video Music Awards? Well 12.4 million people were watching on Sunday night, the biggest viewership for any show in the 30-year history of the cable channel and continuing the upward ratings trend for the annual awards. Last year's VMAs drew 11.4 million viewers. The fact that MTV set a record on Sunday is all the more significant because swaths of the East Coast were without power because of Hurricane Irene.
